cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet a hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest across the north-west Caribbean, cross or graze western Cuba Tuesday, then continue into the central-northern Gulf of Mexico toward the LA–MS coastline late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system expected to remain well east of Corpus Christi throughout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Pinar del Rio & Artemisa (Cuba) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch: La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Entire Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: NW Caribbean coasts (Jamaica, Cayman Islands, western Cuba) and later the northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the FL Panhandle
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at the port based on current track
weather_observation.wind: Only a 3 % cumulative chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely outcome is breezy conditions below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Corpus Christi coastline because the cyclone remains far to the east
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer fringe showers possible late in the week, but heavy rainfall (≥4 in) is not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and higher than normal surf/rip-current risk along the middle Texas coast late week
